intro: Callerya eurybotrya, commonly known as the Chinese hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to China and Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture, while the fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds.
